result.execSummary:
The defendant Deondre Ramone McDonald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Attempt Attempt Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges as to both counts, including the mandatory DNA surcharge as to count one only.  DNA sample/surcharge waived as to count two as it has been ordered on count one.
To be paid out of up to 25% prison funds and wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count two, and consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 193 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.  No contaqct with the victims Julia M.;  K.A.D; M.M.V; T.C.G.; K.X..

Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*Conditions apply to both counts/case.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

Submit DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one and consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for zero days.
*Defendant does qualify for the  Challenge Incarceration program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 3.5 years Initial Confinement in  cases 15CF1725 and 15CF1553.

charges.descr: Attempt Robbery with Use of Force

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deondre Ramone McDonald

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deondre Ramone McDonald in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Deondre Ramone McDonald in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. 

COUNTS 1 & 2 ARE CONSECUTIVE TO EACH OTHER AND CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 2 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1 years with credit for 193 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 years.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.

COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1.5 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1.5 years.

- The Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge, as it has been ordered in count 1.

AS TO EACH COUNT:
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
 
*
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims: Julia M., K.A.D., M.M.V., T.C.G., K.X.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge (AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY), out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 3.5 years initial confinement in cases 15CF1725 and 15CF1553.


Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant Deondre Ramone McDonald not in court, in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek for the State of Wisconsin, not in court.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel has a family emergency and needs to reschedule.    Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Letters received that were filed on September 14, 2015 from friends/family on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Deondre R McDonald in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Deondre R McDonald in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNT 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 3 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant Deondre R McDonald not in court, in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deondre R McDonald in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Deondre R McDonald in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for scheduling conference. Case adjourned for scheduling conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.A.D., DOB:05/12/1988, Julia M., co-actor M.A.M., DOB:06/17/1999.

Defendant Deondre R McDonald in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Deondre R McDonald in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing

Defendant Deondre R McDonald in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Deondre R McDonald in custody.  
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner Orders the Sheriff Department to collect DNA from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
